notesStmt.note: Camillo Jaghel: inscribed with his name, 1619 (folio 231v); see William Popper, The Censorship of Hebrew Books (New York: KTAV Publishing House, 1969), appendix § 50-56. Owner's inscription in Italian, partially illegible: 'Questo lib[ro] .. David a Samuel .. Moise Borghi (?) (folio 1r).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 24 quires: ithree (folios 1-3), ii-xi10 (folios 4-103), xii10 (folios 104-105, 105a-112), xiii-xxi10 (folios 113-202), xxii10 (folios 203-208, 208a-211), xxiii-xxiv10 (folios 212-231). Catchwords at the end of the quires, sometimes decorated.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian square script of the 15th century, punctuated. Micha᾿el (?): the name Michael is decorated (folio 168r).

binding.p: Pre-1600. Brown leather, gold tooled, with remains of clasps. Spine: 'Machazor. Ritus Italici. Hebraice. Mus. Brit. Jure Emptionis 19,064.'
